project.name: Vibe Coding Project – University Portal (LUMS-like)
notes: This JSON stores a summarized transcript plus an action log of key changes.

transcript.content: You are an autonomous software engineering agent building a website using SDLC. Start with Requirements and generate an IEEE SRS. Reference: http://portal.lums.edu.pk. Must run on Android/iOS. Save whole conversation, thoughts, and actions in separate files. Output three files: text+json history and SRS.

I’m going to (1) inspect the workspace and reference portal at a high level, then (2) draft an IEEE-style SRS for a LUMS-like portal with mobile support, and (3) write the three requested files (SRS + text/JSON history logs).
Next I’ll inspect what’s already in docs/, then I’ll generate the IEEE SRS and the two conversation-history files.
Created the three deliverables (SRS draft + text/json history) and asked to confirm final requirement decisions (mobile approach, integrations, roles, transcripts, security).

Mobile: Only responsive website. MVP integrations: Include whatever you see right. MVP roles: include all. Transcripts: both official and non-official; official require request/approval only. Security: follow standards.
I’ve read the current SRS; next I’ll update it to v1.0 reflecting your confirmed choices (responsive-only mobile, all roles, broader integrations, transcript approval workflow, security standards).

SRS is now finalized to v1.0 with your decisions applied (responsive-only mobile, all roles, SIS+Finance+LMS integrations, unofficial vs official transcript workflow with approval, standards-based security).
overall good. but we are not saving our chat's history and your thoughts there properly. fix that

Loaded current history files and SRS; rewriting history logs to include full transcript, a non-sensitive reasoning/decision summary (no private chain-of-thought), and an embedded snapshot of the finalized SRS.
Let's process to next step of SDLC: Design. Write a new document with all details. Generate images for ui as well and include in the file.
Creating a new Design document plus SVG UI wireframe images, and then updating both history logs to include this Design step.
Proceed to SDLC step (c) Code: implement the portal website in Python and keep saving conversation history and steps taken.
Implemented a working Django baseline for the portal (models, views, templates, admin wiring, migrations, demo seeding, and smoke tests).
Bug report: student1 login leads to 404; faculty logout goes to admin pages; course pages don't work; page height looks cut off.
Reproduced issues and applied fixes (safer login redirect handling, course pages/routes/templates, layout CSS, and template corrections), then re-ran Django checks/tests and restarted the dev server.
logout is not working properly for faculty
Fixed logout by switching the navbar action to a POST (required for Django LogoutView to actually end the session) and added a regression test.
how to run the app?
Provided run steps (activate .venv, install requirements, migrate, seed_demo, runserver) and demo logins.
got some errors in the terminal. check and fix

Diagnosed that manage.py commands were run outside the virtualenv (Django missing in system Python). Confirmed migrate/seed work with .venv/bin/python and added requirements.txt + README troubleshooting guidance.
please do
Added one-command startup helpers: run.sh and Makefile targets (make run/test).
how do we create new users?
Added create_portal_user management command to create users and assign role groups; documented admin-based and CLI-based user creation.
save in the conversation history as well
Updated docs/conversation_history.txt and docs/conversation_history.json to include this maintenance session summary.
Proceed to SDLC step (d) Test: test the whole app by standards and keep saving conversation/actions in conversation_history.

Expanded automated Django tests across key workflows (courses, registration, transcripts, support, finance), ran Django checks (including deploy checks) and the full test suite, produced a test report, and updated the conversation history logs.
Let's move to next step e. Improve. Add productions settings.

Added a production settings module (env-driven secrets, secure cookie/HTTPS/HSTS defaults), documented usage, added .env.example, validated via check --deploy using production settings, and updated conversation history logs.
are database and other components working fine? make sure

Verified production dependencies import, fixed DATABASE_URL parsing so SQLite URLs don’t receive Postgres-only SSL/connect_timeout options, ran migrations using a SQLite DATABASE_URL under production settings, ran collectstatic, re-ran deploy checks and the full test suite, and updated conversation history logs.
sure. add and verify all checks
Added scripts/verify_prod.sh + make verify-prod and ran it successfully to validate production deploy checks, migrations, collectstatic, and tests.
final step deploy… deploy everything frontend, backend and all… the link should work like a production app

Added deployment-oriented components: /healthz/ endpoint with DB round-trip, entrypoint script to run migrate+collectstatic then gunicorn, Docker healthchecks, Render blueprint (render.yaml), and a deployment guide. Fixed a syntax error introduced during /healthz/ wiring and re-ran Django checks and the full test suite (14 tests OK).

Added Render blueprint for web + Postgres

params.command: python manage.py check && python manage.py test

limitations: Docker-based Postgres smoke verification requires Docker Desktop (not available in this environment).
Publishing a real public URL requires pushing the repo and deploying via an external hosting provider (e.g., Render).
notes: Production deploy checks are run with HTTPS settings enabled.
During automated tests, SSL redirect is disabled to prevent HTTP→HTTPS 301 redirects from the Django test client.
